hinglish: main apne desh se pyaar karta hoon
kumaoni: ma mero desh se pyaar karyun

hinglish: Jaante ho (agar purush se puchh rahe ho)
Jaante ho (agar mahila se puchh rahe ho)
Kya tum kumaoni bol sakte ho?
Nahi. Lekin main kumaoni samajh sakta hoon.
kumaoni: Na yaar, lekin Kumaoni samajh leenu.

hinglish: Kya tum kumaoni seekhna chahte ho?
Haan. Main ise seekhna chahta hoon.
Tumne ye mobile phone kab khareeda?
Kya tum Anil Mehra ko jaante ho? (purush se puchh rahe ho)
Kya tum Anil Mehra ko jaante ho? (mahila se puchh rahe ho)
Haan, woh tumhare gaon ka sarpanch hai.
kumaoni: Hoi. yo haman gaonk serpanch cha.

hinglish: Main Jageshwar se shaadi shuda hoon, jo Almora mein hai.
kumaoni: Meyar beyahh Jageshwar bhatik honch, jo ki Almor main chhoo.

hinglish: Maine abhi tak kuch decide nahi kiya hai.
kumaoni: Meel aayee tai kuch nee soochi.

hinglish: Kya tum mere saath shaadi karogi?
Mujhe is bare mein sochne ke liye thoda samay chahiye.
kumaoni: Meek kuchh tame deao soachare leje.

hinglish: Main Delhi mein ek call centre mein kaam karta hoon.
kumaoni: Mee Delii main ek Call Centre mai kaam keranoo.

hinglish: Main mangalwar ki shaam ko aaunga.
Kya tum chay ya coffee piyoge?
kumaoni: Kya tum chaahaa coffee pasand nee kerana?

hinglish: Kya tumne dopahar ka khana kha liya?
Nahi, aaj main vrat par hoon.
Kya tum kabhi Nainital gaye ho?
Mera gaon Lohaghat mein hai. Uska naam Raushaal hai.
kumaoni: Mear goon Lohaghat main choo. Jo ki Raushaal ak naamel jarhi.

hinglish: Tum apne gaon kab gaye the?
kumaoni: Tum aaper goon kadhin bati nee geya?

hinglish: Main pichle saal October mein gaya tha.
kumaoni: Mee pichhari saal october main jerau(n)chi.

hinglish: Kya tumhare gaon mein bijli hai?

kumaoni: Na, humar goon main bijul naathi.

hinglish: Tumhare paas kitne gaye aur bakriyan hain?
kumaoni: Tumar pass keduk gouru bakar chan?

hinglish: Hamare paas do gaye aur panch bakriyan hain.
kumaoni: humar pass dwe gouru aur panchh baakar chan.

hinglish: Pichle saal gehun ki fasal kaisi thi?
kumaoni: Pichhali saal tumer geahon kheti kasi Bhee?

kasi Bhee
 NOTE: kasi Bhee will be used in End onthe sentence

hinglish: Bahut acchi nahi thi. Barsaat mein fasal kharab ho gayi thi.
kumaoni: Eduk bhali nee hayee. Thaadi fasal barshalet khatam hain pari.

hinglish: Pichle mausam mein barsaat kaisi thi?
kumaoni: Pichhari saal main bersat kasi rainchh?
Jaduk aasha chhee u haber jyada hainch.

hinglish: Tum thodi der baad ja sakte ho.
Kya main andar aa sakta hoon?
Haan. Tumhe iske liye kisi permission ki zaroorat nahi hai.
kumaoni: Hoi. Kilak naa, tamukoo puchar jaroorat naaithi.

hinglish: Kya main jyada baat karta hoon?
kumaoni: Meel jyada batul to nee kehal.

hinglish: Paon chhuna (bade logo ka aadar karne ke liye)
Tumhare liye swasthya, sampatti aur samriddhi ki shubhkamnayen
kumaoni: Twes sukh, sampatti aur samriddhi ki shubhkamna

hinglish: Tum mere jeevan mein roshni le aate ho
kumaoni: Tu myar jindagi mein roshni le chu

hinglish: Tumhare jaise dost kam milte hain
kumaoni: tyar jais sangi milna mushkil chu

hinglish: Main khushnaseeb hoon ki tum mere dost ho
kumaoni: Myar khushnaseeb chu ki tu meru sangi chu

hinglish: Tum mere sabse ache dost ho
kumaoni: Tu myar sabse badhiya sangi/dagadya chu

hinglish: Main tumhari bahut yaad karta hoon
kumaoni: Main twes bahut yaad karnu chun

hinglish: Mera dil tumhare liye dhadakta hai

kumaoni: Tu ke che? / Aap ke che?

hinglish: Haan. Main school mein kaam karta hoon.
kumaoni: Hoi. Mee school main kaam kar chou.

Girana
Example: usne doodh gir diya
kumaoni:
पोख हा 
Example:  ऊल दूध पोख हा।

hinglish:
Stri ke liye sarvanam
Example: Woh ek doctor hai

Example: usne doodh gir diya

पोख हा

Stri ke liye sarvanam

Kahan
Example: Woh log kahan se hain?
Main theek hoon. Tum kaise ho?
kumaoni: Main theek choo(n). Tum kas chou?

hinglish: Ghar ke aur log kaise hain?
Tum aajkal kya kar rahe ho?
Main Pushp Vihar mein rehta hoon, Saket ke paas.
kumaoni: Main pushp vihar saketak paas roon chou.

hinglish: Aur tumhare saath ghar mein kaun kaun rehta hai?
kumaoni: Aur ghar mein ko ko rooni tumaar dagad?

hinglish: Main apne maa-baap, chhoti behen, bade bhai aur bhabhi ke saath rehta hoon.
kumaoni: Main apan eza-baabu, naani beni, thul dada aur bauji dagad roo(n)chou.

hinglish: To tumhare bade bhai ki shaadi ho gayi? Kab?
kumaoni: O..tumar thul dadak byaah haigo? Kabin?

hinglish: Haan, uski shaadi pichle saal hui thi.
kumaoni: Hooye, ook byaah pichal saal haigu.

hinglish: Tumhari behen kis class mein padhti hai?
kumaoni: Tumari naani baeni ko wali class main pare(n)?

hinglish: Tum ravivar ko hamare ghar kyon nahi aate?
kumaoni: To tum Itvaar din hamar ghar kalie na oona?

hinglish: Itne din baad tumhe dekh kar sab khush ho jayenge.
kumaoni: Sab tumuko(n) bahut din baad dekhi ber khush haie jaala.

hinglish: Main khud un sabse milna chahta hoon. Main ravivar ko aane ki koshish karunga.
kumaoni: Mein lag oonuk dekh ber khushi holi. Mein itvaar din oonake koshish karou(n).

hinglish: Theek hai. Main ab chalta hoon.
Theek hai, ravivar ko milte hain.
kumaoni: Theek cha pein Itvaar din miloon.
(tu) - chhoto ke liye,  (tum) - bado ke liye

hinglish: Main Pushp Vihar mein rehta hoon, Shiv Mandir ke saamne.
kumaoni: Mee pushp vihar main shiv mandire Pachhil ruunu.

hinglish: Tum kis class mein padhte ho?
Tumhare school ka naam kya hai?
Mere school ka naam GIC Narayan Nagar hai.
kumaoni: Meyar school naam GIC Narayan Nagar chhoo.

hinglish: Tum aajkal kya kar rahe ho?
Mera ek chhota bhai aur ek badi behen hai.
kumaoni: Myar ek naan bhai aur ek thul banhi chhoo.
